BiblioData.Title: SPIN-TRANSFER TORQUE OSCILLATOR
BiblioData.Abstract: The invention relates to a method of operating a spin-transfer torque structure to generate voltage oscillations, said structure comprising a first layer of magnetic material having a fixed magnetization vector, a spacer of non magnetic material and a second layer of magnetic material having a free magnetization vector. The method includes the application of a current (j op) through said structure and a magnetic field (H ext ) in the plane of the second layer. It makes use of a region of bistability and hysteretic behaviour to trigger and stop the voltage oscillations.

Claims.P: 1. Method of operating a spin-transfer torque structure to generate voltage oscillations, said structure comprising a first layer of magnetic material having a fixed magnetization vector, a spacer of non magnetic material and a second layer of magnetic material having a free magnetization vector, said method including the application of a current through said structure and characterized by the steps of: - setting the operating point of said structure in a region of bistability where the magnetization vector of the second layer can be either in a stable static state or in a stable precessing state; - increasing the current in absolute values above a first threshold value, thereby inducing a precession of the magnetization vector of the second layer; and then decreasing the current in absolute values below said first threshold value, the magnetizing vector of the free layer being thereby kept in said precessing state.

2. Method of operating a spin-transfer torque structure to generate voltage oscillations, said structure comprising a first layer of magnetic material having a fixed magnetization vector, a spacer of non magnetic material and a second layer of magnetic material having a free magnetization vector, said method including the application of a current through said structure and characterized by the steps of: setting the operating point of said structure in a region of bistability where the magnetization vector of the second layer can be either in a stable static state or in a stable precessing state; increasing the current in absolute values above a first threshold value, thereby causing the magnetization vector of the second layer to move out of the plane thereof; and then decreasing the current in absolute values below a threshold value causing the magnetizing vector of the second layer thereby to enter a stable precessing state.
3. Method according to claim 1 or 2, characterized in that the steps of increasing and then decreasing the current are performed by applying a current pulse.
4. Method according to any preceding claim, characterized in that it further comprises the application of a magnetic field (Hext) in the plane of said second layer.

5. Method according to any preceding claim, characterized in that it further comprises a step of stopping said voltage oscillations by decreasing the current in absolute values until the operating point is moved out of said region of bistability into a region where only a static state of said magnetization vector is stable.
6. Method according to claim 5, characterized in that the step of stopping said voltage oscillations is performed by applying a current pulse.

7. Method according to claim 4, characterized in that it further comprises a step of stopping said voltage oscillations by varying the magnetic field in a predetermined direction until the operating point is moved out of said region of bistability into a region where only a static state of said magnetization vector is stable.
8. Method according to claim 7, characterized in that the step of stopping said voltage oscillations is performed by applying a magnetic field pulse.

9. Method of operating a spin-transfer torque structure to generate voltage oscillations, said structure comprising a first layer of magnetic material having a fixed magnetization vector, a spacer of non magnetic material and a second layer of magnetic material having a free magnetization vector, said method including the application of a current (jop) through said structure and a magnetic field (Hext) in the plane of said second layer, said method being characterized by the steps of: - setting the operating point of the spin- transfer structure in a region of bistability where the magnetization vector of the free layer can be either in a stable static state or a stable precessing state; varying the magnetic field in a predetermined direction until it crosses a third threshold value, thereby inducing a precession of the magnetization vector of the second layer; varying the magnetic field in the opposite direction until it crosses back said third threshold value, the magnetizing vector of the free layer being thereby kept in said precessing state.

10. Method according to claim 9, characterized in that said steps of increasing the magnetic field in said predetermined direction and in said opposite direction are performed by applying a magnetic field pulse .

11. Method according to claim 9 or 10, characterized in that it further comprises a step of stopping said voltage oscillations by varying the magnetic field in said opposite direction until the operating point is moved out of said region of bistability into a region where only a static state of said magnetization vector is stable.
12. Method according to claim 11, characterized in that the step of stopping said voltage oscillations is performed by applying a magnetic field pulse.

13. Method according to claim 9 or 10, characterized in that it further comprises a step of stopping said voltage oscillations by decreasing the current in absolute values until the operating point is moved out of said region of bistability into a region where only a static state of said magnetization vector is stable.
14. Method according to claim 13, characterized in that the step of stopping said voltage oscillations is performed by applying a current pulse.
15. Method according to any preceding claim, characterized in that the magnetization vector of said first layer is orthogonal to the plane of this layer.
16. Method according to any preceding claim, characterized in that said spacer is a layer of non magnetic metal.
17. Method according to any claim 1 to 15, characterized in that said spacer is a layer of insulating material.
18. Method according to any preceding claim, characterized in that the first layer of magnetic material and the second layer of magnetic material are made out of ferromagnetic material.
